attributes.comment:
RE: Docket number: USCIS-2006-0044
I am in the process of adopting a baby internationally and have already paid the
petition fees for my I-600A which were expensive enough. I feel that adoption is way
too expensive as it is for people who cannot have children or those wanting to add to
their families. Raising the fees for adoption-related petitions makes it even HARDER
on us financially to adopt a child who needs a loving and safe home. It's not about the
money....it's about the children. It should ONLY be about the children and we should
have their best interests at heart and not make it difficult for us by emptying our bank
accounts before we get them home. We have to support them financially. Doesn't
anyone think of that before raising fees? Adoption is way too expensive and to raise
any of the HUGE fees we are facing will be more stressful and for most people a huge
struggle. I strongly object to raising the fees by up to 66% for adoption-related
petitions! We're trying to help the children so why would fees be raised to slow down
the process and the gift of helping children? THINK ABOUT THE CHILDREN!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kelly D. Day
